attributes.action: establish the principle that when an intruder to private premises locked bolted alarmed or otherwise protected is apprehended there is a presumption of guilt.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Any apprehended criminal is bound to plead "Not Guilty" because there is always a chance that the charge against him/her could be dropped on a technicality or by the clever arguments or actions of a defending barrister.  In the case of breaking and entering a locked bolted or alarmed premises which clearly is intended to exclude intruders, the equally clear intention of the intruder to force entry is indicative of guilt and this ought to be presumed at court and clearly stated to the defendant whose intrusion has thwarted attempts by the premises owner to exclude unwanted intruders.

reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
